title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When shutting down Windows without saving a dirty .txt file in a WSWB session, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes. As a result, the dirty file is lost after shutdown.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file, the system should display a warning or confirmation message to give users a chance to save their changes before shutting down.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left-click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down or reboot the computer.

Expected results:
- A warning or question message box should appear, giving users the option to save their dirty file before proceeding with the shutdown.
